page.title: 01ST. PETER'S CHURCH, RUSHBURY
page.content: The church shows evidence of{Roman {herring-bone brickwork}near the porch. The original bells and clock in the {square tower}are dated{1621.}The bells were repaired and rededecated in 1978-9. There is a{Leper's squint}near the vestry where lepers could follow the service. The{first tombstone is dated 1672 and is of a vicar of the parish. It can be found in the porch.Other interesting graves are of the{Cleeton {and Wainwright}families,(see page 16). Inside the church, at the back,is a screen dedecated by Mrs. Williams of Stanway Manor in 1912.An ancient plaque gives details of the{Tipton {endowment}.The shields on the beams were renewed in 1985.
